availability.p: This image and transcription is publicly accessible. The image appears courtesy of the repository named in the Source Description. The transcription and annotation were undertaken by Kentucky Historical Society staff, volunteers, and interns. If referencing this document title, accession number, and permanent URL.

seriesStmt.title: Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition
Early Access

msIdentifier.repository: Kentucky Department for Libraries and Archives
msIdentifier.collection: Office of the Governor, Thomas E. Bramlette: Appointments by the Governor, Civil Appointments, 1863-1867

creation.placeName: New York, New York County, New York

body.p:
State of New York
City and County of New York } SS:

I Frederick I. King having been duly appointed a Commissioner of Deeds for the State of Kentucky as appears by my Commission duly Issued and signed and sealed at Frankfort On the Third day of November One Thousand Eight Hundred and sixty three

Do Solemnly swear that I will well and truly execute and perform all the duties of my station as such commissioner and that the following is a true impression of my new seal of Office as such Commissioner

Subscribed and sworn to before me this 3d day of May 1864
Henry A. Foster
FREDERICK I. KING
COMMISSIONER OF DEEDS FOR
KENTUCKY
NEW YORK

New York
Oath of
F. I. King
Comr Deeds
7th May/64

State of New York,
City and County of New York, } SS.

I, HENRY W. GENET, CLERK of the City and County of New York, and also Clerk of the Supreme Court, for the said City and County, being a Court of Record, DO HEREBY CERTIFY, That Henry A. Foster before whom the annexed deposition was taken, was, at the time of taking the same a a Justice of the Supreme Court of the State of New York for said City and County, duly elected and sworn, and that his signature thereto is genuine, as I verily believe.
In Testimony whereof, I have hereunto set my hand, and affixed the Seal of the said Court and County, the 3d day of May 1864
